Class BookController

public class BookController
extends java.lang.Object
    Book controller which handles all books functionality

    • Method Detail

      • showBooks

        @RequestMapping(value="/showBooks")
public java.lang.String showBooks(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Gets ArrayList of Books from service, and adds to model to be displayed in view when /showBooks page is loaded
        Parameters:
        m - Model which is used to add list of books to jsp view
        Returns:
        string of .jsp page to be loaded
        See Also:
        BookService

      • addNewBook

        @RequestMapping(value="/addBook",
                method=GET)
public java.lang.String addNewBook(@ModelAttribute(value="book")
                                                                                                   Book book)
        Get and display addBook when navigated to, this page allows the user to add a book
        Parameters:
        book - Book model which is the object bound to the form, and is used to get data from the form
        Returns:
        string of .jsp page to be loaded

      • newBookAdded

        @RequestMapping(value="/addBook",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String newBookAdded(@ModelAttribute(value="book")
                                                                                                      Book book,
                                                                                                      org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
        Post request which is called on submit of form.
        Parameters:
        book - Book model which is the object bound to the form, and is used to get data from the form
        result - Used in validation of form inputs, e.g displays error message if fields are empty.
        Returns:
        string of .jsp page to be loaded using redirect so if page is refreshed it won't call add method again.
        See Also:
        BookService

      • editBook

        @RequestMapping(value="/editBook/{bId}",
                method=GET)
public java.lang.String editBook(@ModelAttribute(value="book")
                                                                                                        Book book,
                                                                                                        @PathVariable(value="bId")
                                                                                                        java.lang.String bId,
                                                                                                        org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Get and display editBook when navigated to, this page allows the user to edit a books details which are pre-loaded and added to the form using the bId passed in the url
        Parameters:
        book - Book model which is the object bound to the form, and is used to get data from the form
        bId - gets the string from the url
        m - Model which is used to add old book data to jsp view
        Returns:
        string of .jsp page to be loaded.
        See Also:
        BookService

      • editedBook

        @RequestMapping(value="/editBook/{bId}",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String editedBook(@ModelAttribute(value="book")
                                                                                                           Book book,
                                                                                                           @PathVariable(value="bId")
                                                                                                           java.lang.String bId,
                                                                                                           org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result,
                                                                                                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Post request which is called on submit of form. This gets the values from the form and is used to update the database using the new inputs.
        Parameters:
        cust - Customer model which is the object bound to the form, and is used to get data from the form
        cId - gets the string from the url
        result - Used in validation of form inputs, however doesn't seem to work for updates
        Returns:
        string of .jsp page to be loaded using redirect so if page is refreshed it won't call add method again.
        See Also:
        CustomerService

public org.springframework.context.MessageSource messageSource()
